resources.string: A database is an organized collection of structured information, or data. Usually stored electronically on a computer system. A database is usually controlled by a database management system

The Database can be compared to a spreadsheet of information. Each column corresponds to an Attribute. \nIn the case below we have several attributes from a table called CUSTOMERS. \nWe have the attributes NAME, SURNAME, DATE BIRTH, PHONE and CPF
Each line has information that can be Inserted, Edited and Deleted. In the example highlighted above, for example, we have a registration of a person with the following data:
Name: Marcia, Last name: Brandão, Born on 01/15/1995, Phone (31)99314-5498 and CPF 658.454.151-87

To manipulate the data in our base we need a DBMS, which is the Database Management System. \nSince we learned the concept, let start practicing SQL (Structure Query Language). \nIn our case we will use SQLite, but we must remember that there are other DBMS that also perform the same function of manipulating stored data. As said, ours will be SQLite.
The SQL language can be divided into DML (Data Manipulation Language) and DDL (Data Definition Language). \nWhere DML is focused on Data Manipulation and DDL is focused on Data Definition.

After having created our CLIENT table, we can now insert data into it. Follow the example below:
SELECT is a command to fetch data that is already recorded in the table.
DELETE is a command to delete data that is already recorded in the table.
DROP is a command to delete the created table.
The UPDATE is a command to change data that has already been inserted in the table. So if we want to change some information on our table we will use the UPDATE statement.

ALTER is a command used to alter an already created table.. \nYou can Add a Column, Delete a Column, or even Rename a Column. \nLet see these 3 options, but the ALTER command has more options for editing a table.
